name: Triad of Fates
text:
{1}, {T}: Put a fate counter on another target creature.
{W}, {T}: Exile target creature that has a fate counter on it, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
{B}, {T}: Exile target creature that has a fate counter on it. Its controller draws two cards.

name: Trial
text: Return all creatures blocking or blocked by target creature to their owner's hand.

name: Triangle of War
text: {2}, Sacrifice Triangle of War: Target creature you control fights target creature an opponent controls. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

editions.flavor: The Zhalfirin war triangle represents a trinity of might, faith, and guile.
The Zhalfirin war triangle represents a trinity of might, faith, and guile.

name: Triassic Egg
text:
{3}, {T}: Put a hatchling counter on Triassic Egg.
Sacrifice Triassic Egg: Choose one —
• You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only if two or more hatchling counters are on Triassic Egg.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only if two or more hatchling counters are on Triassic Egg.

name: Tribal Flames
text: Domain — Tribal Flames deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

name: Tribal Forcemage
text:
Morph {1}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Tribal Forcemage is turned face up, creatures of the creature type of your choice get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.

name: Tribal Golem
text: Tribal Golem has trample as long as you control a Beast, haste as long as you control a Goblin, first strike as long as you control a Soldier, flying as long as you control a Wizard, and "{B}: Regenerate Tribal Golem" as long as you control a Zombie.

name: Tribal Unity
text: Creatures of the creature type of your choice get +X/+X until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Kamahl left the violence of his former life behind him, but he still believes in the power of muscle.
Kamahl left the violence of his former life behind him, but he still believes in the power of muscle.

name: Tribute to Hunger
text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

editions.flavor: Marella was delighted. The ball had attracted so many suitors for her daughter, including that handsome stranger. She wondered where the two were now . . . .
Marella was delighted. The ball had attracted so many suitors for her daughter, including that handsome stranger. She wondered where the two were now . . . .

name: Tribute to the Wild
text: Each opponent sacrifices an artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor:
"You may enter, but leave those lifeless things of your world behind."
—Modruni, maro-sorcerer

"You may enter, but leave those lifeless things of your world behind."
—Modruni, maro-sorcerer

name: Trickbind
text:
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Counter target activated or triggered ability. If a permanent's ability is countered this way, activated abilities of that permanent can't be activated this turn. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

name: Trickery Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
• Target creature becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
• Look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

name: Tricks of the Trade
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and can't be blocked.

editions.flavor: "Pathetic. You might as well have protected your treasures with a paper box and some string."

name: Trickster Mage
text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

editions.flavor: "If it ain't broke, I'll break it. If it is broke, I'll fix it."

name: Triclopean Sight
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
When Triclopean Sight enters the battlefield, untap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.

text:
Trigon of Corruption enters the battlefield with three charge counters on it.
{B}{B}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Trigon of Corruption.
{2}, {T}, Remove a charge counter from Trigon of Corruption: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

name: Trigon of Infestation
text:
Trigon of Infestation enters the battlefield with three charge counters on it.
{G}{G}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Trigon of Infestation.
{2}, {T}, Remove a charge counter from Trigon of Infestation: Create a 1/1 green Insect creature token with infect.

name: Trigon of Mending
text:
Trigon of Mending enters the battlefield with three charge counters on it.
{W}{W}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Trigon of Mending.
{2}, {T}, Remove a charge counter from Trigon of Mending: Target player gains 3 life.

Trigon of Rage enters the battlefield with three charge counters on it.

{2}, {T}, Remove a charge counter from Trigon of Rage: Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

text:
Trigon of Thought enters the battlefield with three charge counters on it.
{U}{U}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Trigon of Thought.
{2}, {T}, Remove a charge counter from Trigon of Thought: Draw a card.

name: Trinisphere
text: As long as Trinisphere is untapped, each spell that would cost less than three mana to cast costs three mana to cast. (Additional mana in the cost may be paid with any color of mana or colorless mana. For example, a spell that would cost {1}{B} to cast costs {2}{B} to cast instead.)

editions.flavor:
"This exhibition of Nehra's Threshold Principle must be expropriated and examined for its potential applications in enforcement."
—Confiscation directive
Designed to restrain petty thoughts, but used to repress entire empires.

name: Trinket Mage
text: When Trinket Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

name: Triplicate Spirits
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Create three 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying. (They can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

name: Trip Noose
text: {2}, {T}: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor: A taut slipknot trigger is the only thing standing between you and standing.
A taut slipknot trigger is the only thing standing between you and standing.

name: Trip Wire
text: Destroy target creature with horsemanship.

editions.flavor: Trip wire, hooked poles, and sunken pits were commonly used to unhorse riders during the Three Kingdoms period.
Trip wire, hooked poles, and sunken pits were commonly used to unhorse riders during the Three Kingdoms period.

name: Triskaidekaphobia
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one —
• Each player with exactly 13 life loses the game, then each player gains 1 life.
• Each player with exactly 13 life loses the game, then each player loses 1 life.

name: Triskelavus
text:
Flying
Triskelavus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Triskelavus: Create a 1/1 colorless Triskelavite artifact creature token with flying. It has "Sacrifice this creature: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

name: Triskelion
text:
Triskelion enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Triskelion: Triskelion deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: A brainchild of Tawnos, the Triskelion later proved both versatile and useful.

"Why do bad things always come in threes?"
—Gisulf, expedition survivor
A brainchild of Tawnos, the Triskelion proved its versatility and usefulness in many of the later battles between the brothers.

"Why do bad things always come in threes?"
—Gisulf, expedition survivor

name: Triton Cavalry
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Triton Cavalry, you may return target enchantment to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The tritons broke the surface, and the Nyxborn broke ranks.

name: Triton Fortune Hunter
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Triton Fortune Hunter, draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Thassa has blessed me with power and insight. I am careful not to disappoint her."

name: Triton Shorestalker
text: Triton Shorestalker can't be blocked.

editions.flavor: "Who will miss you, drywalker? A wife? A child? Perhaps they will blame the sea for your fate, and teach future generations to stay far away from it."

At sunrise, the Champion and her companions awoke to find their supplies gone and Brygus, their sentry, dead. Carefully arranged piles of ornamental shells gave a clear warning: go no further.
—The Theriad

name: Triton Tactics
text: Up to two target creatures each get +0/+3 until end of turn. Untap those creatures. At this turn's next end of combat, tap each creature that was blocked by one of those creatures this turn and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

name: Triumph of Cruelty
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent discards a card if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power.

editions.flavor:
"I've seen corpses prettier than you, beastmage."
—Liliana Vess

name: Triumph of Ferocity
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power.

editions.flavor:
"Rid me of this curse, witch, or die with me."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Triumph of the Hordes
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample and infect. (Creatures with infect deal damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

editions.flavor: Battle tempers soldiers as fire tempers steel.

name: Troll Ascetic
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic.

editions.flavor: It's no coincidence that the oldest trolls are also the angriest.
It's no coincidence that the oldest trolls are also the angriest.
It's no coincidence that the oldest trolls are also the angriest.
It's no coincidence that the oldest trolls are also the angriest.

name: Trollhide
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{1}{G}: Regenerate this creature." (The next time the creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

name: Troll-Horn Cameo
text: {T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"I found a troll-horn fragment in the wooded foothills of Hurloon, and it keeps growing larger. I wonder, is the horn recreating itself or the troll?"
—Isel, master carver

name: Trolls of Tel-Jilad
text: {1}{G}: Regenerate target green creature.

editions.flavor: "The secret of this world weighs upon us, and we have been shaped by time and duty to bear it."

name: Tromokratis
text:
Tromokratis has hexproof unless it's attacking or blocking.
Tromokratis can't be blocked unless all creatures defending player controls block it. (If any creature that player controls doesn't block this creature, it can't be blocked.)

name: Tromp the Domains
text: Domain — Until end of turn, creatures you control gain trample and get +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.

editions.flavor: Ground into the footprints of the ravaging herd were clumps of salt from Benalia, moss from Llanowar, dust from Hurloon, and ash from as far as Urborg.
Ground into the footprints of the ravaging herd were clumps of salt from Benalia, moss from Llanowar, dust from Hurloon, and ash from as far as Urborg.

name: Trophy Hunter
text:
{1}{G}: Trophy Hunter deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
Whenever a creature with flying dealt damage by Trophy Hunter this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Trophy Hunter.

name: Trophy Mage
text: When Trophy Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 3, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: "The tools of the past will help us forge the future."

name: Tropical Island
text: ({T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.)

name: Tropical Storm
text: Tropical Storm deals X damage to each creature with flying and 1 additional damage to each blue creature.

editions.flavor:
"After the storm, I found a sea turtle dying on the sands, a blade of grass driven through its shell."
—Travelogue of Najat

text:
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
{1}{G}{W}, {T}: Populate. (Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)

text: Exile target creature, then populate. (Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)

editions.flavor:
"Some cannot be saved as they are, but all can serve the Worldsoul."

name: Troublesome Spirit

Flying

editions.flavor: As erratic and turbulent as a summer squall.

name: Truce
text: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two a player draws this way, that player gains 2 life.

editions.flavor: If an anurid's lucky, it'll find a warm tunnel for bedtime. If a wurm's lucky, it'll find a warm anurid for breakfast.

text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, if that player had another land enter the battlefield under his or her control this turn, Tunnel Ignus deals 3 damage to that player.

editions.flavor: Fight mischief with mischief.

name: Tunneling Geopede

editions.flavor: As Ulamog's brood reduces the earth to dust, geopedes burst from their tunnels in search of solid ground.

name: Tunnel Vision
text: Name a card. Target player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until the named card is revealed. If it is, that player puts the rest of the revealed cards into his or her graveyard and puts the named card on top of his or her library. Otherwise, the player shuffles his or her library.

name: Turbulent Dreams
text:
As an additional cost to cast Turbulent Dreams, discard X cards.
Return X target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor: Laquatus dreams of seizing control.

text:
Target player can't play land cards this turn.

—Sisay

name: Turn
text:

name: Turn Aside

editions.flavor: "Your arrogance is my best weapon."
